alert.note: Alert for Beaufort; Mainland Dare; Mainland Hyde; Tyrrell; Washington (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Washington, northwestern Hyde, west central Dare, east central Beaufort and Tyrrell Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 500 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Weeksville to Belhaven. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Southern Shores, Belhaven, Killkenny, Ponzer, Scranton, Alligator, Gum Neck, Kilkenny, Fairfield, Columbia, East Lake, Woodley, Sanderling, Leechville, Winsteadville, Sidney Crossroads, Newfoundland, Frying Pan Landing, Lake Mattamuskeet and Pungo Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for eastern North Carolina.

area.areaDesc: Beaufort; Mainland Dare; Mainland Hyde; Tyrrell; Washington
